required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Prefabrication of Body Surface Tissues/ Organs(e.g. Joint)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1/2 Study of Autologous Tissues/Body Surface Organs Prefabrication in Tissue Reconstruction

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to observe the feasibility and its application of autologous prefabrication for body surface tissues/oranges

detailed_description.textblock: In the field of tissue regeneration techniques, the in vitro processes and other exogenous factors still have many uncertainties. These uncertainties have hampered road to the clinical application. As the importance of in vivo environment has aroused more awareness, the investigators validated the hypothesis that the feasibility of self-regeneration prefabricated unaided by any in vitro culture process or exogenous elements.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion 12 months after prefabrication

secondary_outcome.description: To observe the regeneration changes of prefabricated neo-tissue by histology (staining) and biomechanical analysis (bone density, Young`s modulus)

other_outcome.measure: survival of prefabricated tissue after grafting
biomechanical function of prefabricated tissue after grafting
other_outcome.description: Assessed by total range of motion (degree)

other_outcome.measure: biomechanical function of prefabricated tissue after grafting

clinical_study.condition: Intentional Self Harm by Other Specified Means

arm_group.description: in vivo generation of autologous tissue for joint replacement

intervention.description: tissue/ organ is prefabricated in vivo independent of exogenous factors for replacement/ reconstruction purposes

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery, Shanghai 9th People'sHospital

facility.name: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital, Affliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, PhD, Professor, Head of the Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery, Shanghai 9th People'sHospital Affiliation: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
